title: Gravitational force of planet on satellite

content.question: A satellite of mass <math alttext="1,000 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is in a circular orbit around a planet. The centripetal acceleration of the satellite in its orbit is <math alttext="5 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the gravitational force exerted on the satellite by the planet?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
